fields.description: Currently when doing a space export from the web GUI, the automatically generates a file name of Confluence-export.zip  . It would be helpful if there was a step that lets you name the file before the export begins. this is especially useful if doing multiple exports back to back.
fields.summary: Allow file name selection when doing a Space Export

fields.description: Modify the logic in the Space Export screen to show the actual number of attachments for that space. Currently when doing a Space export, the web GUI shows the total number of attachments for the site, not for the space being exported. See attached screenshot. !Export1.png!
fields.summary: Modify the logic in the Space Export screen to show the actual number of attachments for that space

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The breadcrumb is malformed if the space name is long

h3. Environment
*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space with the name "Test space name size impact on breadcrumbs"
# Create a page on the space
# Open the page

h3. Expected Results
The name of the space is fully shown or just part of it, like "Test space name size.../"

h3. Actual Results
A / is shown in the middle of the space name
 !Screen Shot 2017-09-27 at 2.02.24 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
*

h3.Workaround
*
fields.summary: The breadcrumb is malformed if the space name is long

fields.description:
Hello,

Please help me, how i can add to my cloud Confluence instance the "Archiving Plugin for Confluence"? Or his analogue?
fields.summary: Add "Archiving Plugin for Confluence" to my instance

fields.description: In previous Questions for Confluence, users could see the questions that other users had answered, would this be doable on this new version?
fields.summary: Allow users to see other user's answered questions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Personal spaces no longer are showing the *Delete Space* tab.
 !personal_space_delete_option.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any Personal Space;
# Select Space tools from the sidebar;
# The *Delete Space* tab should display under Overview option.

h3. Expected Results
*Delete Space* tab can be selected and the user can proceed with the space delete.

h3. Workaround
Reach the *Delete Space* using a URL hack
* https://YOURINSTANCENAME.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/removespace.action?key=*SPACEKEY*
fields.summary: Delete Space option missing in Personal Spaces

fields.description:
h3. Summary


Unable to move the page to a different space, they will be seeing the following error:

{code}
You cannot move this page to another space because you do not have permission to delete it from this space.
{code}


h3. Steps to reproduce

1. Create 2 space called *Test 1* and *test 2*
2. Create a page called *Atlassian Test* in *Test 1* space
3. Go to  *Atlassian Test* page and click move



h3. Observed behaviour

New space is grey out and we unable to choose other space. At the same time, seeing the following error:
{code}
You cannot move this page to another space because you do not have permission to delete it from this space
{code}

!error.png|thumbnail!


h3. Expected behaviour

The User should be able to move a page to different space.




h3. Workaround

#  Click on Browse
# Then select your space and click on a page title
# After that, go back to Advanced
# The new space name will be filled and you may search for the new parent page.
fields.summary: Unable to move page to another space

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Space import is failing due Confluence Question permission.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export a space
# Try importing the space on Cloud

h3. Expected Results
Import is done

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the Confluence Cloud log:
{noformat}
Unable to complete import: Error while importing backup: The scope of the import extends outside of the space.
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-53910 <- similar bug but different permission

h3.Workaround
# Search for *ac:com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions:question* in the entities.xml file.
# Scroll up to the first mention of object class="SpacePermission" package="com.atlassian.confluence.security" above *ac:com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions:question*
# Delete from the line <object class="SpacePermission" package="com.atlassian.confluence.security"> all the way through to the very next </object> tag inclusive of both lines
# Search for others with *ac:com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions:question* and repeat until there's none
# Save the entities.xml file and add it back to your space zip.
fields.summary: Import space is failing due to permission ac:com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions:question

fields.description:
In the editor, you can indent macros, but the indent doesn't survive after publishing.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Create some headings, paragraphs, and add a Tip macro and a Code macro.
 # Select-All
 # Press indent-right
 # Publish

Expected:
 * Entire page is indented

Actual:
 * Tip and code macros are aligned to the left edge
fields.summary: Macros do not indent correctly
Creating Space with Permissions Not Working (REST API)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When selecting two cells in a table (while editing page), Confluence view jumps up on the page scrolling the screen automatically. This only occurs in the new Confluence Experience and only occurs if you have multiple section in the page
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud
 * New Confluence Experience
 * It happens on Chrome (60.0.3112.113) and EDGE, although on EDGE it scrolls to the bottom.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable the new Confleunce Experience on instance: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/new-navigation-and-a-new-look-for-confluence-881536766.html]
 # Create large Table with dummy content. Must be big enough to were there is a scrollbar present
 # Add an additional section below the table - insert text (doesn't need to be a table). Two sections are enough
 # Publish page - must be published once to reproduce issue
 # Edit page again
 # Scroll the screen down a little
 # Select two cells of any tables and when you stop holding the click of the mouse, the screen will jump up (or down if on EDGE)

h3. Expected Results
 * Be able to select two cell in a table without activating the scroll

h3. Actual Results
 * After selecting two cell on the table the browser will scroll up (down if on Edge)

h3. Notes
 * Was able to verify this on all infrastructure using the new Confluence Experience
 * Only occurs when sections are created and added
 * Not data specific and is reproducible

h3. Workaround
 * Do not add any additional sections to Page. Remove existing section to only leave one > Issue does not manifest when using only 1 section
fields.summary: Selecting Cell in Confluence Editor Causes Page to Jump Around When Using Sections

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence users that have been restricted to a small number or single space using Space permissions will see in the Activity feed, the creation of the Team Calendar page for spaces that they cannot access.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
NOTE: I tried to reproduce this issue in a test instance however the Issue could not be reproduced for new spaces.
# create a user with membership to a single group
# Provide access to a space through the group-level Space permissions in the space you wish to allow the user and do not provide Permissions to this group in any other space.
# browse to the Activity feed

h3. Expected Results

User only sees links to activity items that they have access to.

h3. Actual Results
User is able to see the [SpaceName]'s Calendar activity.

h3.Workaround
There is currently no workaround.
fields.summary: Users See Team Calendar Page creation in activity feed for spaces they do not have access to

fields.description:
h3. Problem.
- There's not a way to disable notifications on Confluence in a widespread way, only specific to each user. We don't want email notifications automatically sent when pages are added or edited.

h3. Suggestion
- Add a feature to limit notifications just as the notification schemes of JIRA.

h3. Workaround
- Disable per user
fields.summary: Disable Email notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem
We're not able to hide the Created by information on pages using style macro or CSS since its restricted, also, the macro doesn't work on the new interface.

h3. Suggestion
Allow to remove it with CSS customization or implement a function to remove the Create by information

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Hide Created By on the header of pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary

 In Confluence Questions, users can select a specific space to ask questions in, but you cannot force your users to ask questions in a specific space, such as Global Space.

 As a result, questions can get created in multiple places.
h3. Suggested Resolution

Allow admins to force that all questions get created in a specific space, such as Global Space.
fields.summary: As an admin, force users to ask questions only in specific space

fields.description:
h3.Summary
If you use the Questions for Confluence link in some page to send the user to Questions, or you copy it, it will be something like this:
{code}
https://MYINSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/ac/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions
{code}

h3.Expected Behavior
When clicking on the link, or pasting it into the browser and going to it, it should open the Questions page.

h3.Actual Results
You end up with a *Page not Found* error, the same as the one when going to /wiki/questions.
fields.summary: When clicking/pasting Questions for Confluence link, there is a Page Not Found error

fields.description:
h3. Problem summary

We've observed instances where the Create JIRA option is missing from the selected text hover context menu (but the comment-from-quote option is still there) seemingly intermittently, without explicit change to the system from users or administrators.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

This issue is intermittent, and we do not have clear steps to reproduce. However, the problem appears to be with the in-memory cache. When the issue is present, you can observe the issue by following these steps:
 # go to any confluence page
 # highlight any text and hover the mouse over the highlighted text.

h3. Expected Results

Both the Create JIRA issue button and the create inline comment button should appear.
h3. Actual Results

Only the create inline comment button appears.
 There are no errors in the logs.
h3. Workaround

Flushing the "JIRA Resource Manager" Confluence cache should solve the issue.

If that doesn't work, try flushing all Confluence Cache via "/wiki/admin/cache/".

*NOTE: Please record which workaround worked for you*

(!) Confluence Cloud instances will need to file a support request at [https://support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com/] to request we run this for you due to permission restrictions on both flushing cache and content indexing.
fields.summary: Caching problems can cause the option to create JIRA Issue from highlighting text to become missing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Browsing through inline comments using the keyboard shortcuts (*n* and *p* to move down or up) is freezing the page in the browser making it unresponsive.

h3. Environment
* Any Internet browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a few inline comments to a page (3 in the example).
# Use the *n* shortcut to browse through the comments.

h3. Expected Results
You are able to browse through the comments without any issues.

h3. Actual Results
After the first few hits, the page becomes unresponsive. It sometimes comes back to normal after a while but not always.
Some other times you have to kill the browser and re-open it.
It is not possible to add inline comments once you reach that stage as the comment box appears but cannot be filled.
 
h3.Workaround
Use the arrow buttons to browse through the comments instead.
fields.summary: Performance issue with Inline comments actions such as browsing or adding new ones

fields.description:
The customer came across want to merge all work from one account to another. However nowadays is not possible.

THe new suggestion came to add a "merge" button where you can select both accounts and merge one to another.
fields.summary: Ability to assign all work from one account to another

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When editing a macro in particular Road Map Planner, the background is editable by pressing "E" on the keyboard
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create/Edit a page
 # Press E
 # Type in any words, you'll see that the background is editable

h3. Expected Results

Nothing happens when pressing E
h3. Actual Results

Background is editable
fields.summary: When editing a macro, the background is editable by pressing "E" on the keyboard

fields.description:
The user experience of macros inside the iOS app implies as a vendor we have a bug rather than conveying there isn't support for macros inside the iOS app. This issue was originally raised by an evaluator to our support.
h3. Steps
 # Install a connect add-on with a dynamic macro
 # Create a page with a dynamic macro in it via a desktop browser
 # Open the iOS Confluence app (v2.6.1) and view the page

h3. Apps affected
 * [Poll for Confluence Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.addonengine.pollconfluenceaddon/cloud/overview]
 * [Macro Toolbox for Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.addonengine.macrotoolboxforcloud/cloud/overview]

h3. Notes
 * This error also appears for some inbuilt Confluence macros e.g. lorem ipsum, page tree.
 * If you use the "Include Page" macro to include a page that contains a dynamic macro you see a different message (see attached screenshot)
 * No web request is made to the server when the page is loaded in the iOS app
 * Raised here by another developer but with no answers: [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/broken-macro-in-ios-android-app/8037]

 

More information on: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/projects/DEVHELP/queues/custom/165/DEVHELP-718
fields.summary: Dynamic macros display as "Broken macro" in the iOS Confluence app

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customers who have the Attachment Macro on a page to show their Attachments, cannot preview the Attachments by clicking on the links shown.  When the link is clicked, they are prompted to download the file

h3. Environment
* Cloud; tested in Chrome, Firefox, and Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page and Add an Attachment Macro; publish page
# Upload attachments to the page
# Refresh page and click on a link to one of the attachments

h3. Expected Results
The Lightbox preview appears and previews the selected Attachment

h3. Actual Results
User is prompted to download the file
 
h3. Notes
The documentation for the [Attachments Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/attachments-macro-724765160.html] implies that it allows users to Preview Image Attachments and/or Edit Office/PDFs using the Office Connector.  Previews and Edit are bypassed if the file is downloaded locally. 

h3.Workaround
Expand the dropdown to the File Attachment and click on the "View" button:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Attachment Macro Does Not Generate Preview When Attachment is Clicked

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Uploading files to Confluence Cloud using Firefox takes too long compared to other browsers.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any page from Confluence Cloud in Firefox;
# Enter edit mode and upload an attachment (here a 8kb file was used);
# The file can take from 50s to 4 min to upload.

h3. Expected Results
The file should upload in a few seconds.

h3. Workaround
Use Chrome or Safari to upload the attachments.
fields.summary: Uploading attachments to a page takes too long in Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While trying to search with the sidebar (quicksearch), Confluence no longer displays the result. Instead, it will display blank content. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the search option, from the sidebar (or type g+g to bring the search)
# Write anything

h3. Expected Results
The sidebar should bring the results for what you are searching. Not only pages but, administration functions as well.
h3. Actual Results
Nothing is displayed. Only blank content. 
h3. Notes
The recent accessed is still displayed there, as long as the user does not write anything while searching. Also, if you hit *Enter* for what you are searching, it will redirect you to the search page, which is expected.

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Sidebar's Quicksearch no Longer Display Results

fields.description:
Previously, Confluence would Shrink Tables to fit any window size and would allow traversal of the smaller table size using a table-only scroll bar. This does not occur on tables that are sufficiently small to begin with.
On Sufficiently large tables, Table shrinking does not seem to occur.

This causes the usability of some medium sized tables to be reduced and reduces the consistency of the overall user experience.
fields.summary: Improve consistency of Confluence Tables to shrink to fix any page size, and use table scrollbar for navigation.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Livesearch macro in the body of a page displays the *_d&\#39;_* code instead of the *'* character when another page has this *'* character in the title.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and add the Livesearch macro to it
# Create another page and add the *'* character to its title
# Go back to the page with the Livesearch macro and search for the page you created on step #2

h3. Expected Results
The page name would be display as is
h3. Actual Results
The page name is displayed with a *_d&\#39;_* code instead of the *'* character

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Livesearch macro shows character code instead of ' character in the page title

fields.description:
Hello Team,

Our customer wants to have the ability to set default home page for each user  groups, today is not possible to make this settings.

The idea is to put an option where you can have a box to add the home page for that specific group
fields.summary: Able to set different home page per groups

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the iOS version of Confluence, on lower resolution devices such as the iPhone5S/5C, the Confluence logo is cut on both sides, does not scale to match resolution. While this was reported on iOS, there is a possibility that more modest Android devices suffer the same way (tested on a Huawei P10 Lite, 1080*1920 resolution, worked fine).
h3. Environment 

iOS app on iPhone 5S or below, possibly Android.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 - Obtain a suitable device or simulate one via xcode's simulator (or Android studio for Android)
 # Step 2 - Install confluence and run. Loading screen will be cut. 

h3. Expected Results

Centered, scaled logo
h3. Actual Results

See Images below:

!original.jpg|thumbnail!     !Image-1.jpg|thumbnail!  

 
h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Confluence logo is cut on lower resolution devices (e.g. iphone 5s/5c

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Macro function to get the username that watches the page at Confluence editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Watch a page.
 # Get the username that watches the page.

h3. Expected Results
 * Have a function to get the username that watches the page.
fields.summary: Macro function to get the username that watch the page at Confluence editor.

fields.description:
* Install an add-on, or create one with these properties:
 ** A dynamic macro with a "username" parameter type
 ** Set this macro parameter to be "multiple": "true"
 * Insert this macro in to a page
 ** Add the macro to the page
 ** In the editor, a user picker is created for the username parameter

Actual: The userpicker does not find any users

Expected: The userpicker listsusers
 * This has been reproduced on IE11 but also reported to happen on Edge (see original report here: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/CE-1135)
 * Removing the "multiple" property of the parameter fixes this issue and users are searchable
 * Watching the network logs in ie11 shows a valid response but no error message in the console suggesting it was failing to parse.
fields.summary: Macro browser user picker shows no users

fields.description:
Why should it take so long to load the macros window?? And there's no loading indicator, so the user is left wondering if they actually triggered the show macro action or not.

We're using confluence cloud and it takes 5-6 seconds for this modal to show up. This should really be fixed. At least show some sort of loading indicator so the user knows what's going on. 

Another user complained about this here: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Re-Inline-code-blocks/qaq-p/644977/comment-id/86485#M86485
fields.summary: Confluence macro modal takes ~5-6 seconds to show up

fields.description:
This has been and continues to be a serious weakness of Confluence and Hipchat.

Confluence is used heavily by software teams. Software teams speak in sentences mixed with code. Forcing us to use code blocks that break the flow of a sentence is a really poor flow.

Slack gets this 100% right. I can type:
{quote}We should really consider using `const toolpane =` instead of using `var toolpane =` when we don't expect the variable to change
{quote}
That should just work. Meaning it will auto-format my inline code snippets. It works on Slack. It works on Github. It is high-time it works on Confluence as well. 

Anything less is just a bad experience. I haven't met a single person yet who disagrees with that.

I recently onboarded 25 people to Confluence. And damn, every single technical person struggled with this. Such friction!

Why not support this? Why force us into the slow, annoying macro workflow. Just follow the rest of the software world and let us use ` and ```.

 

*Atlassian Status as of August 2018*

Since we've started to gradually roll out a new editing experience, we've addressed this as part of the new experience and you can learn more about it by following these links:
 * https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html)
 * https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/keyboard-shortcuts-markdown-and-autocomplete-724764956.html) 

Please let us know if you have any feedback!

Confluence Product Management
fields.summary: Support inline code blocks like Github and Slack

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, if page access is granted via email link and the page restriction was due to parents, then the page will be blocked from access. 

h3. Customer Story
A user receives a link to a page and when trying to view it receives a message stating that the page is restricted and he can "Request access".
<<image>>

That button triggers an email to the creator of the page with a button to "Grant Access" to the page. The email says:
<<image>>

When the creator clicks the button a page restriction is added to the page to grant access but because there were not previous restrictions on that specific page (the restriction was on the parent) the page is restricted to +all+ users. User is still blocked by parent restrictions and creator is also now blocked due to individual page restrictions.

h3. Example
A page "Child" has two level parent pages "Parent-1" & "Parent-2" then setting page restrictions on "Child" via email link wont' work as "Child" is really unable to be accessed due to inherited restrictions from "Parent-1" & "Parent-2".

h3. Cause
The "Request Access" email feature is not checking for parent restrictions.
More information at [Permissions and Restrictions - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/permissions-and-restrictions-724765432.html]
  
h3. Customer Impact

Customer loses access to the page although to their understanding they have only granted access to another user and they are the creator of the page. Not even admins will have access.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a *Parent Page* and a nested *Child Page*.
 # Restrict *Parent Page* to your user.
 # Ask any user (other than the one who has access to parent page) to access the *Child Page* via link.
 # User is denied access and given the option to request access to the *Child Page*. Hit *Request Access* button.
 # An email is triggered and sent to the page owner(s) with a link to grant access to the *Child Page*.
 # Clicking on the "Grant Access" button
 # Both the owner and requester check to see if they can access the *Child Page*.
 
h3. Expected Results
Requester should be given access to the *Child Page* and everyone who previously had access still has access to it.

h3. Actual Results
*Child Page* is completely blocked. Everyone who had access to the page including creator, is blocked from accessing it.

h3. Suggestion:
The wording of the email could be:
"User X requested access to page Y but access to this page is restricted by the parent page Z. In order to grant the user access to the page, please modify the parent page restrictions."
and not show a "Grant Access" button.

h3. Workaround
*To recover access to the page:* as a space admin navigate to "Space Tools" -> "Permissions" -> "Page Restrictions" and remove the page restrictions.
*To prevent this from happening:* manually ensure that the page does not have any inherited access restrictions from parent page(s). If page inherits restrictions, grant access on the parent page.
fields.summary: Page with a parent page with restrictions is blocked from access when granting access to it via email link

fields.description:
The code block macro works well for highlighting code, but it's a PAIN to use.

The #1 item to adjust on each and every code macro is the syntax highlighting language.

It would be great if there was a way to specify options on the command line when adding a code macro. i.e.


{{ \{code:bash<enter> }}

This would speed things up dramatically when adding code documentation or snippets.
fields.summary: Expand code macro to accept syntax highlighting language in macro  name

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian,

We use JIRA to track the progress of contracts worth several millions of pounds. We have a number custom field associated with the JIRA project to hold this value. When we search in JQL within JIRA the number renders correctly and is also nicely readable with the automatic addition of commas.

!Screen Shot 2017-09-23 at 12.36.19.png!  

 

However, when we use the JIRA macro in Confluence in order to report on the status of these contracts and their costs, the number renders in scientific notation with an exponent (1.7E7). Not only is this inconsistent with the behaviour in a JIRA JQL search, it is highly confusing for the viewers of the reports in Confluence. People viewing the reports are finance people that do not expect to see scientific notation in such a report (see below).

!Screen Shot 2017-09-23 at 12.42.03.png!

I believe that JIRA is doing some sort of conversion internally into scientific notation for values over 999,999 - which I believe also causes this problem: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Why-doesn-t-JIRA-Regular-Expression-Check-validator-work-as/qaq-p/606305]

Please ensure consistency by making Confluence and JIRA treat values over 999,999 as proper numbers instead of converting them into exponents! It's terribly confusing in most circumstances.

Best,

Gary
fields.summary: Make JIRA number fields holding values over 999999 render without scientific notation when using JIRA macro in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Ability to have the same page name on a different level of page structure.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Structure of the folder

# Create Parent page.
# Create I want same title(same level with the Parent page).
# Create a child page with the title I want same title under a Parent page.

- Parent page
- I want same title
- I want same title

h3. Expected Results
* Able to create the same page name with a different level of page structure.

h3. Actual Results
* Able to create the same page name with a different level of page structure.

h3.Workaround
* None.
fields.summary: Ability to have the same page name on a different level of page structure.

fields.description: We have videos related to our team work that we would like to document on Confluence. After research, we realized that either we should use widget connector macro to imbed the video or we can use HTML Macro to embed the video. However, neither of the options are workable for a brightcove video on a cloud version of Confluence. We would like to request Atlassian consider to allow brightcove videos in the widget connector macro. Thanks.
fields.summary: Support Brightcove videos in the Confluence Widget Connector Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Links to an Anchor on top of the page refresh the page when clicked instead of scrolling the page to the Anchor, when the page content contains a macro that causes the content to render inside an iframe. 
h3. How to Replicate 
 # In Firefox, create a page with some anchor links – e.g. there is an anchor macro at the top of the page, and links within the page content to jump back to the anchor at the top of the page
 # Add a macro that would cause the page content to render inside an iframe (e.g. activity stream macro)
 # When viewing the page, click on one of the links to jump to the anchor at the top of the page

h3. Expected Result

You are navigated to top of the page where the anchor is placed.
h3. Note

This behavior will be reproducible in all browsers.
h3. Actual Results 

The page is reloaded.

 

Workaround:

Open the links in a new tab (use the middle-click on your mouse if you have a three-button mouse, ctrl-click on Windows/Unix, or cmd-click on Mac.) and they should redirect you to the correct anchor.
fields.summary: Anchors on different page are not working as expected

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While looking at pages, Confluence no longer displays a popup notifying the users that the page has been edited/updated, it just sends an email about the page notification, which would force users to refresh the page in order to look for modified content. Also, there are no number of modifications for the page displayed on the browser's tab. For example, (X number of modifications).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start watching a page in Confluence
# Have another user editing this page while you have it opened in the browser

h3. Expected Results
A popup should be displayed. Something like: "This page has been updated by User X"

h3. Actual Results
No popup notifications will be displayed 

h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment. Indeed, the user will receive the update through the email or while editing the page.
fields.summary: Page Update Notification Popup not Displaying

fields.description: Users want to be able to remove the activity log from confluence
fields.summary: remove activity log from dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Instance have Jira and Confluence cloud application.
* Link inside new user invitation email with permission to Confluence application only should redirect to the Confluence application instead to Jira application.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to https://instance_name.atlassian.net/admin/users/add
# Fill in the email address, username, and full name.
# Uncheck the Jira Software text box(not grant the Jira permission).
# Fill in the group permission.
# Check the Send invitation email.
# Click Create user.
# The new user got the invitation email and click the "Join them now" button.

h3. Expected Results
* The new user that granted Confluence user application only on the link inside the invitation email, then click "Join them now" button will be redirected to Confluence instead Jira.

h3. Actual Results
* The new user that granted Confluence user application only on the link inside the invitation email, then click "Join them now" button will be redirected to Jira application.

h3.Workaround
* None.
fields.summary: Link inside new user invitation email with permission to Confluence application only should redirect to the Confluence application instead to Jira application.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence Cloud has issues uploading files and attachments. There are cases of customers being unable to provision a trial Confluence instance.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Status
 * See updates on [Atlassian Status|https://status.atlassian.com/]
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud issues with uploading files, attachments, trial provisioning
Blog stream is not showing latest blog update

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Questions for Confluence users are unable to at-mention other users within the instance and receive a "Something Went Wrong" popup message

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to Questions for Confluence and Ask A Question
# In the Description, at-mention someone else
or
# Navigate to Questions for Confluence and locate a Question and try to Answer it
# In your Comment, at-mention someone else

h3. Expected Results
At-Mention renders an Autocomplete list so that you can select who to mention

h3. Actual Results
When someone tries to at-mention:  
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

In a Browser Dev Console, seeing multiple 40X Errors with Atlassian System Account: 
{code}confluence-questions.prod.atl-paas.net/rest/questions-connect/1.0/vote/140503246 Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 403 ()
app.js:1 Dispatching ... fetchUserVotes_ERROR, status code: 403
app.js:1 Error:  Error
    at new RestError (app.js:1)
    at app.js:1
    at <anonymous>
(anonymous) @ app.js:1
pf-mentions-service.atlassian.io/mentions/302e81de-3c40-4f36-9c04-6cbd9bbb2bf4/bootstrap?productIdentifier=connect.confluence.questions Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 401 (Unauthorized)
media-api.atlassian.io/picker/auth/cookie Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 403 (Forbidden)
pf-mentions-service.atlassian.io/mentions/302e81de-3c40-4f36-9c04-6cbd9bbb2bf4/bootstrap?productIdentifier=connect.confluence.questions Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 401 (Unauthorized){code}
OR
{code}2pf-mentions-service.atlassian.io/mentions/34134231-7017-4a26-84c2-f014265a2412/bootstrap?productIdentifier=connect.confluence.questions Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 401 (Unauthorized)
media-api.atlassian.io/picker/auth/cookie Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 403 (Forbidden){code}
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
None

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Confluence Server, the users can [disable the add-ons responsible for content export|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-disable-pdf-export-for-pages-or-spaces-711361415.html], like PDF.

However, in Cloud, this would be a restricted function due to needing to disable add-on modules. This is a suggestion to have a bundled option to disable the page export option for specific users or pages, for content like PDF, Word, XML. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to restrict certain users or groups from exporting pages of specific spaces while still allowing them to have view access.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict page export permissions from specific users or groups

fields.description:
When in edit mode or preview mode, the page tree macro displays an icon beside the page title, but when publishing the page there are no icons are displayed.

  !page_tree_macro_edit.png|thumbnail!      !page_tree_macro_preview.png|thumbnail!      !page_tree_macro_published.png|thumbnail!

The page tree macro should have the same behavior in editor, preview or published modes.
fields.summary: Page tree macro preview and edit mode should match the published macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you have a link to a nonexistent page and you click this link to create this nonexistent page, the page title isn't automatically filled according to the link you just clicked.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit/Add a page and in the body of this page create a link to a page that doesn't exists yet
-- You can do this by typing [This is the name of the new page]
# Save this page
# While viewing the page the link to the *_+This is the name of the new page+_* page is there, so click it

h3. Expected Results
The editor opens up for you to create this new page, and the page title should already be autofilled according to the link on the previous page, on this example the page title should be *_+This is the name of the new page+_*
h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
The page title is blank.

 !movie.gif! 

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Link to create new page page doesn't autofill page title

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the page has a bullet list and you try to add a task in this bullet list all bullet lists in the same level of the tasks are converted to task as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and add a bullet list to this page with a few lines
# At the bottom bullet click the Task button on the editor to add a task

h3. Expected Results
The other bullet lists remain as bullet list.
h3. Actual Results
All the previous bullet points are converted into tasks. See below:

 !bug.gif! 
 

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Adding a Task below a Bullet List makes the Bullet lists tasks

fields.description:
In Confluence, when a user start [watching content|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/watch-pages-spaces-and-blogs-724765353.html], the same will receive notifications for different actions.

This is a suggestion to allow the users to configure which kind of notification will be triggered according to the [Email Notifications configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/email-notifications-724765358.html] on their profile. For example, a checkbox on the *Email Settings* for the following:

* *Page Edit*
* *Comment*
* *Mentions*
* *Attachments* 
* *Delete*
fields.summary: Granular Watch Notification For Confluence
Unable to export Issue Statistics and Agile Wallboard Gadget macro to PDF

# Insert Issue statistics and Agile wallboard gadget macro to the page.
# Click ellipsis(...) menu on the right page > Export to PDF.

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

h3.Workaround
* None.

If Admin username Clashes with Atlassian Account username Site Import Fails

fields.description:
Using rest/api/latest/content with a POST identifying page content WITHOUT an ancestors field to have the page NOT be in the home page hierarchy.

On some instances, the page is being added to the HOME page hierarchy. This is incorrect.

This just started happening recently (worked on Sept 7) and it is only failing on some instances.

# fails on bobswift.atlassian.net 
# fails on bobswift-test.atlassian.net 
# works on bobswift13.atlassian.net

All instances report the same level:
{noformat}
Version . . . . . . . . . . . : 1000.2002.0
Build . . . . . . . . . . . . : 6452
{noformat}

We MUST be able to continue to add pages without an ancestor.
fields.summary: REST API for adding pages defaulting ancestors to home page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Line wrapping doesn't work on Preformatted Text inside a Info Macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with a Info Macro
# Inside the Macro, put a long piece of text
# Format the Text as Preformatted
# Publish the Page

h3. Expected Results
Text should be wrapped within the macro.

h3. Actual Results
Text overrides the macro limit.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Line wrapping doesn't work on Preformatted Text inside a Info Macro

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the [Confluence Google Drive|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/confluence-google-drive/cloud/overview] add-on doesn't support dragging files from Google Drive and dropping them into Confluence while viewing the page. Very similarly to what we have today when we add the Attachments macro to the body of the page, we simply drag and drop the files into the macro and the files are attached to the page.
h3. Suggested Solution
While viewing the page we should drag the file from Google Drive and drop it into the page, and the file should be added to this page.
h3. Why this is important
This will improve usability and agility since the page wouldn't need to be edited for that.
fields.summary: Allow drag and drop in the Confluence Google Drive add-on

fields.description:
Users that aren't Space Admins, but have *View* and *Add Pages* permissions on a Space, can go to *Space Tools* > *Content Tools* > *Reorder pages*.
However, these users do +not+ see the 'Reorder Pages' button when navigating through 'Pages'.

Currently, only users with *Admin* permissions can see this button.
fields.summary: Users with permissions to Reorder Pages do not see the 'Reorder Pages' button on 'Pages' unless they have Space Admin Permissions

fields.description:
h3.The Issue
On ADG3, Users are not able to edit the space logo, when clicking on the *Edit* button, nothing happens. 

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Go to Space
# Click on *Space Tools*
# Next to the Space Logo, click on *Edit*

h3.Expected Results
You are able to select a picture

h3.Actual Results
Nothing happens
fields.summary: Cannot Edit Space Logo

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Some Confluence Cloud instances are unable to export the page to PDF, it happens intermittently.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the page.
 # Click ellipsis(...) menu on the right page > Export to PDF.

h3. Expected Results
 * Able to export the space/page to PDF.

h3. Actual Results
 * Export to PDF is not working stuck at 0% progress.

h3. Workaround
 * Export to Word.
fields.summary: Unable to export space/page to PDF.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence on Mobile Browsers is rendering Desktop version

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a mobile device (iOS or Android), access a Confluence instance.

h3. Expected Results
It should display a mobile version of the site.

h3. Actual Results
It shows the same as the Desktop version.
fields.summary: Confluence on Mobile Browsers is rendering Desktop version

fields.description:
Implement the option to receive wiki notifications as a daily digest instead of a potentially huge amount of emails.

The current solution is to let the author decide whether to send a notification which is not good enough in the case where Wiki moderators have to make sure the pages are in good shape and prevent incorrect information from entering the Wiki. As far as I know there is no option to watch a Wiki space in a way that you are notified about all changes.

On the other hand, being notified about all changes will create a lot of spam. The solution would be to offer a daily digest for all wiki spaces you are watching (separate from the interesting changes newsletter). It would be great if each user could modify the frequency with which they want to receive emails (immediately, every hour, daily, every week, etc). They should also be able to choose whether they only want changes marked as "notify" or all changes.

Current approaches like the No Email Storm plugin are not reasonable for this as they will reduce the amount of notifications sent, but instead of organizing them in an efficient manner.
fields.summary: Implement a daily digest for Wiki changes on watched pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some Confluence Cloud instances are unable to generate a backup as the operation is stuck and only displays a spinning wheel before showing an error message:
{noformat}
Export error
Export in progress - not responding
But don't worry, we'll fix it for you!
You just need to contact Atlassian support and paste in this error message, timestamp and your instance details.
Timestamp: 2017-09-19T11:52:59.491
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Launch a backup generation

h3. Expected Results
A backup generation is triggered and generates a backup of Confluence.

h3. Actual Results
The backup operation is stuck at 0% and only displays an infinite spinning wheel before displaying the error message
{noformat}
Export error
Export in progress - not responding
But don't worry, we'll fix it for you!
You just need to contact Atlassian support and paste in this error message, timestamp and your instance details.
Timestamp: 2017-09-19T11:52:59.491
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
None.

h3. Notes
This is also impacting page PDF export and space export as XML and PDF.
fields.summary: Export operations are stuck and not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Vertical scrollbar shows beside images in a age.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a page with a 3-column layout.
In each column add an image with a caption at the bottom of each image.
Change the captions to *Bold* of type *Heading1* and publish

h3. Expected Results
The page should show the images with the captions without a side scrollbar for each image.

h3. Actual Results
The page show the images with the captions and a side scrollbar for each image.

h3. Workaround
Change the caption to *Heading2*

h3. Version
1000.0.0-568127a
fields.summary: Vertical scrollbar shows beside images
Media API token expires while creating zip file

fields.description:
Priority - Low
T-shirt Sizing - Small
Ideal ETA - October 31

This issue affects iOS mobile app and is preventing push notifications from making any sound or vibration.

The fix is to add a new "sound" variable to the push notification payload that we send to our push notification service which relays the request to Apple push notification servers. Thus this can only be fixed on the server-side.

This is the iOS push notification payload code inside the mobile REST plugin ([https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/MOB/repos/confluence-mobile-rest/browse/plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/mobile/model/notification/IOS.java#89-96)]

Since we don't need to customize the sound, we can just add a new "sound" variable and hardcode its value to "default", and then update the "hashCode" and "toString" methods.

The end result we want is to have "Aps\{... sound=default, ...}" in the payload that we send to push notification service.

#CIM-1801
fields.summary: [Mobile] Push Notification doesn't make any sound/vibration on iOS device
PDF Export and Code Block Issues with Non-Latin Characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Publishing a Draft with Unpublished Changes by the owner will keep that user as responsible for those changes

h3. Description
When making changes and publishing a draft previously saved by the owner of a page, the changes are logged as made by the page's owner instead of the person who has published it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# User A creates a Page, publish it, then edit again, leaving some unpublished changes
# User B goes to that page and starts editing it
# User B publishes the changes

h3. Expected Results
Watchers are notified that User B made changes to that page.

h3. Actual Results
Watchers are notified that User A made changes to that page.
fields.summary: Publishing a Draft with Unpublished Changes by the owner will keep that user as responsible for those changes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

"GET"ting the /wiki/rest/api/content REST API endpoint with the Status field set to "any" causes the following error:
 !error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Browse to https://instancename.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content?spacekey=EXAMPLEKEY&type=page&title=EXAMPLEPAGE&status=any

h3. Expected Results
Valid pages are returned as JSON result.

h3. Actual Results
!error.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
Using "status=current" or "status=trashed" still works normally. Also, not specifying a status works.

h3.Workaround
collect using "status=current" and "status=trashed" and aggregate the two result sets.
fields.summary: GET /wiki/rest/api/content Status Any causes Internal Error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence, if a space is restricted and an anonymous user (user without credential) tries to access the same, instead of facing a *404* about a page not found (as mentioned in [this bug report|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-57226]), the user will face only a blank page with a blank sidebar:

!sidebar.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On JIRA, make sure to create a new *Service Desk* project, with the *Customer Service* option. 
# Go to the *Project Settings* and search for the *Knowledge Base* part (https://example.atlassian.net/servicedesk/admin/KEY/confluence-kb)
# There, make sure to *Link to a Confluence space* on your application
# Still on the Project Settings, under the *Access* session, check the "*Everyone with access to your service desk can read articles without a Confluence license. This option is best if you want to share knowledge base articles with your customers.* part.
# Now, on your Confluence space permissions (*Space Tools > Permissions*) you should see a message related to "*Any active user can view this space*"
# Create a page for this space
# Copy the link for the page (https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/KEY/pages/pageid/Page+Name) and make sure to access as an anonymous user.


h3. Expected Results
The anonymous should be prompt with a 404 message or a login prompt.

h3. Actual Results
The page content is displayed blank. The sidebar is also blank, not displaying any of its options. 

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Sidebar Blank (for non logged users) for Spaces with Service Desk Access

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers who are using the Task List as a simple checkbox do not want the text prompt to appear when adding it to their pages
{quote}Type your task here, using "@" to assign to a user and "//" to select a due date{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
* Remove the auto populated text that prompts input for details about the Task being created
* Add a simple checkbox option
 
h3. Workaround 
Manually remove text
fields.summary: Remove Text Prompt from Task List

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users are unable to remove the Task List Checkbox if a Code Block is added inline

h3. Environment
* Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a New Page and add a Task List item (Either by clicking the Task List button or via Keyboard shortcut [ ] ) 
# Input Text into the Task list and then add a Code Macro inline 
!CodeInTask.png|thumbnail! 
# Publish Page and Edit page and try to remove the Task List

h3. Expected Results
Clicking on the Task List button or backspacing over the Task List removes the Task List Checkbox

h3. Actual Results
Clicking on the Task List Button does nothing
Cannot backspace the Task List to remove it

h3. Notes

 
h3.Workaround
Edit the page and add 2 Tasks Above the one containing the Code Block and publish the Page. 
 !2MoreTasks.png|thumbnail! 
Edit the Page, highlight the text, and click on the Task List button to remove the Task Lists; remove extra line breaks as needed.
fields.summary: Unable to Remove Task Report Checkbox if Code Block is Embedded Inline

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Confluence Logo isn't properly displayed in instances with light colours on the Sidebar 

h3. Suggested Solution
When using a light colour on the sidebar, Confluence logo should be darker.
fields.summary: Confluence Logo isn't properly displayed in instances with light colours on the Sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers who are using the Mobile App will receive multiple notifications when changes are made within their instance; one in the Mobile App and a second via Email

h3. Suggested Solution
If a User is active in the Mobile app, suppress Email Notifications.  
For example:  If the user's has recently been in the Mobile App, send an In-App notification and then after a configured timeout send an Email, or suppress the email if they responded/actioned in app
 
h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: Suppress Email Notifications in Favor of Mobile App Notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Changing a PNG image size to under 300px, will cause it to have a black background on Firefox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Firefox, create a new page
# Add a image with a transparent background - through Files and Images
# Set it to a size under 300px

h3. Expected Results
The image should be equally displayed on all sizes

h3. Actual Results
The image gets a black blackground instead of the default white.
fields.summary: Changing a PNG image size to under 300px, will cause it to have a black background on Firefox.

fields.description:
Space shortcuts are replaced with the page tree on child pages. The visibility of these space shortcuts should be configurable.

!image-2017-09-18-17-33-15-687.png|width=600,height=390!!image-2017-09-18-17-33-15-649.png|width=599,height=402!
fields.summary: Show space shortcuts on child pages

fields.description:
The links to overview, pages, blog, Gliffy etc cannot be customised or disabled. These should be able to be enabled or disabled via space tools.

!image-2017-09-18-17-21-41-323.png|width=248,height=306!
fields.summary: Allow sidebar shortcuts to be configurable / customisable

fields.description: !contributors.png|width=684,height=230!
fields.summary: Allow 'Contributors' column in 'Pages' to be hidden

fields.description:
After a space export, the "Fix Macros" action causes an error message saying "undefined".


 !Screen Shot 2017-09-18 at 10.42.56 am.png|thumbnail! 

*Workaround*

Wait 10 minutes and then try again. This error happens if a reindex is currently in process, so waiting for a period of time and retrying can solve it.
fields.summary: Space import - JIRA macro repair - broken

fields.description:
Editing a file on Confluence which doesn't have an extension results in Companion returning "Archive Utility" as the editor for that file type.

This is unexpected behavior, I would assume extension-less files to be of plain text type and therefore show the default editor for ".txt" files
fields.summary: Atlassian Companion offers "Archive Utility" as edit option for extension-less files

fields.description:
h2. Use case
Customers would like to be able to to create similar but highly customized spaces in order to create a consistent set of spaces across Confluence. Having a REST API call to create/remove shortcut links in the side bar would assist in this task.
fields.summary: Ability to add shortcut links to the space side bar via remote API

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence Cloud Customers who are embedding multiple Attachments on a page include the Office Macro, in the Lightbox Preview, the Top Menu bar does not appear

h3. Environment
* Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and add multiple attachments (PNG, PDF, XLSx, DOCx, etc)
# Add attachments to the page by using + > Files and Images
# Add an Office Excel Macro: + > Other Macros, search for Office Excel and select your XLSx file
# Publish page and click on any of the attachments to preview 

h3. Expected Results
Top Menu bar appears so that the user can Select the Version of the file, use the Upload/Download and Edit With buttons, Share, etc 

h3. Actual Results
Top Menu bar does not render; it appears that there is a space for it though:
 !Preview.png|thumbnail! 
No errors in Browser Console
 
h3. Notes
Same results using a Office Word and Office Powerpoint Macros

h3.Workaround
Remove the Office Macro and instead embed any Office Docs using the "Insert Files and Images" option
fields.summary: Light Box Top Menu Does not Appear if Office Macro is on Page

fields.description:
After the [Infrastructure Changes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/questionscloud/blog/2017/05/cloud-infrastructure-changes] in Questions for Confluence, the *Topic* Recent tab is no longer being sorted properly.

All the questions seems randomly sorted onto the page.
fields.summary: Recent under Topic in CQ is not sorted

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Preview file not showing all the content inside the excel file with many rows inside.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create the page.
 # *Insert more content* > *Files and images* > *Upload the excel file(.xlx, .xlsx, .ods)*
 # Publish the page.
 # Click the excel file.

h3. Expected Results
 * Showing all the content inside excel file.

h3. Actual Results
 * * Showing not all the content inside the excel file.

h3. Workaround

fields.summary: Preview file not showing all the content inside the excel file with many rows inside.

fields.description:
Hello,

we have two UserDirectories (LDAP and confluence internal) configured in our confluence.

Before creating a new user in a specific directory I have always to change the order in the directory settings to ne specific directory at top.

When the user is created I have to reorder the directories again.

This is very umconfortable.

A selectbox with the possibility to chose the directoy for the new user on creation would help a lot.

 

Yours sincerly,

Sebastian
fields.summary: UserDirectory selectbox on create new users

fields.description: Every time I arrive on a new site, I am forced to navigate through the ADG3 onboarding dialogs. Ideally I should only see these once, regardless of how many sites I have access to. At the very least, I should be able to dismiss the dialog.
fields.summary: Repeated Confluence ADG3 onboarding
Monorepo the confluence-mobile-rest

fields.description:
Please provide a way to hide the author and last modified information that appears at the top of a page.

There are lots of questions and requests in [Atlassian Community page|https://community.atlassian.com/] referring this matter.
fields.summary: Provide a way to hide author and last modified information

fields.description: When using the IOS app, selecting links from a page produced by a Content by Label Macro do not render. Page tries to pull up but a wheel just keeps spinning...
fields.summary: IOS App - Content by Label Macro will not open linked pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Adding a Navigation Map Macro with a # on the label field will break the page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page
# Add a Navigation Map macro with a "#" on the label field.
# Publish the Page

h3. Expected Results
Page should be normally published and displayed

h3. Actual Results
Page triggers a Page not Found error.
If the page is the homepage for a space, the page will keep loading forever.
fields.summary: Adding a Navigation Map Macro with a # on the label field will break the page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With Confluence in the new look it's not possible to sort tables in pages using Safari. The header isn't clickable.
h3. Environment
Confluence with the new look.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using Safari create a page and add a default table with a header
# Populate the header and a few lines and save the page

h3. Expected Results
When viewing the page you should be able to sort the table by clicking the header
h3. Actual Results
The header isn't clickable. Also the sort icons don't appear in the header.
 
h3. Notes
This works in the old look.

h3.Workaround
Use another browser like Firefox or Chrome.
fields.summary: Unable to sort tables with the new look on Safari

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* On old navigation, when you search the page in the search text box, clicking on any result will display the previously search page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search on the textbox.
# Click result first_page. It will show the first_page.
# Search another page e.g second_page. It will show first_page.
# Search another page e.g third_page. It will show second_page.

h3. Expected Results
* Showing the correct search page.

h3. Actual Results
* Showing the previous search page.

h3.Workaround
* Opt in to the new navigation.
fields.summary: On old navigation, when you search the page in the search text box, clicking on any result will display the previously search page.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Navigate to calendar in a space with existing calendars, showing or hiding certain event types is not working when you use Chrome browser.
h3. Environment

Confluence 1000.0.0-57e69bf
 Google Chrome Version 61.0.3163.79
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # *Access a space*
 # Click on *Calendar* at the sidebar
 # Click on the drop-down arrow and choose *Add existing calendar*
 # Search for the existing Calendar
 # Try to click an event type to show or hide its events

h3. Expected Results
 * Clicking an event type should show or hide its events

h3. Actual Results
 * Clicking an event type is showing a gray rectangle.

h3. Workaround

Use another browser (Firefox)
fields.summary: Unable to show or hide certain Team Calendar event types using Chrome browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Iframe macro not working on new navigation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page.
# Insert iFrame macro.
# Embed the link inside the iFrame macro.

h3. Expected Results
* Iframe macro working in new navigation.

h3. Actual Results
* Iframe macro not working in new navigation.

h3.Workaround
* No workaround.
fields.summary: Iframe macro not working on new navigation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing a blueprint, the label icon is not displayed if the blueprint has not been edited before.
After the blueprint is saved, the label icon is displayed. However, using this modified blueprint with a label applied will not apply the label once the page is created.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a blueprint for the first time (the label icon is not present).
# Save it. Edit the blueprint again (the label icon is now present).
# Add a label to the blueprint and save it.
# Create a new page using the edited blueprint.

h3. Expected Results
The page is created with the correct label applied.

h3. Actual Results
The page is created but does not use the label applied.
 
h3.Workaround
Apply the label after the page is created.
fields.summary: Labels are not applied to Blueprints

fields.description:
In Confluence, when you have content inside a table, the only way to have this content out of the table would be to manually copy and paste it. 

This is a request to allow the user to remove all of the table formatting and retain the data without cut-n-paste on each cell.
fields.summary: Ability to Remove Table Formatting and Retain Data

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When removing a row/or the content of a table row in Confluence, when the user tries to use the *Version Comparision* feature, it will not keep the format of the table on the page. Instead, it just displays the removed text/macro and not that it was inside a table or that a row has been removed as well:

!history.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table in Confluence
# Insert content in different rows of the table (in this case, a bit of text and a JIRA macro)
# Save the page.
# Go back to editing the page and remove one of the rows/content inside the row
# Save
# Click on the *Page History* button, from the page tools (ellipsis button)
# Compare with the previous version

h3. Expected Results
Confluence should keep the format for what has been removed since it can help users on referencing older changes.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
The content of the row does not have the table lines included, only as it was a pure text on the page. 

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Page History Format Not Respecting Tables

fields.description:
(Happened at least on InVision connect add on)

To reproduce:
 # Copy a link that's to be autoconverted to a connect macro
 # Click create a new page
 # Quickly paste the link to the body of the page without adding title or anything

In about ~50% of the cases the autoconvert for the link to an add on fails to convert.

This seems to happen mostly on drafts, but also sometimes when reloading an existing page straight to editor.
fields.summary: Autoconverting Links from a Connect Add-On Sometimes Breaks

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using the Product Requirements template, if you populate the Requirements table with a lot of data on each cell and the table has many lines (more than 60), when you try to create multiple Jira issues from this Requirements table the operation will not complete, it will just create a few issues and a parse error will be presented on the top of the page:
{panel}There were errors creating issues in JIRA. View more
      Parse error:Unexpected token < in JSON at position 0{panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page using the Product Requirements template
# Populate the Requirements table (both Title and User Story columns) with a lot of data (at least 160 characters on each cell on the Title column and at least 290 characters in the Story column)
# Make the Requirements table with at least 60 lines following the requirements above for each line
# Go to the first line and try to create multiple Jira issues from this Requirements table

h3. Expected Results
All issues are created on Jira and linked back to Confluence.
h3. Actual Results
A parse error will be presented on the top of the page:
{panel}There were errors creating issues in JIRA. View more
      Parse error:Unexpected token < in JSON at position 0{panel}

 !Screen Shot 2017-09-13 at 15.46.41.png|thumbnail! 

Also we can see a 500 error on the browser's console on the POST to the jira-integration REST:

{code}
POST https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/jira-integration/1.0/issues?applicationId=5c4edae1-bbd1-36a8-b45a-e54a072fbfee 500 () VM1606 jquery-min.js:3
send	@	jquery-min.js:3
ajax	@	jquery-min.js:3
createIssues	@	VM1937 com.atlassian…t__&locale=en-GB:25
_executeCreateJiraIssue	@	VM1940 com.atlassian…__&locale=en-GB:299
createIssues	@	VM1940 com.atlassian…__&locale=en-GB:299
submitFormWhenValid	@	VM1940 com.atlassian…__&locale=en-GB:289
a.startValidation	@	VM1940 com.atlassian…__&locale=en-GB:274
submit	@	VM1940 com.atlassian…__&locale=en-GB:284
_onSubmitForm	@	VM1940 com.atlassian…__&locale=en-GB:299
dispatch	@	jquery-min.js:2
s	@	jquery-min.js:2
{code}

 !Screen Shot 2017-09-13 at 15.26.56.png|thumbnail! 

Also the following warning appears on the Confluence log:


{code}
2017-09-13T18:07:59.526Z
WARN
Problem communicating with JIRA: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out
{code}

 
h3. Notes
This problem may be intermittent from tenant to tenant, so it may not happen 100% of times.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Creating multiple issues from a table will throw a parse error if the table has a lot of data

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, no way in Content by Label macro to only display certain results which mention a specific page in Confluence. The filter that uses "Including text" doesn't seem to search down into the linked URLs

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option that allows users to filter only results that mention a specific page, or be able to show any pages that refer to children of the current page.
fields.summary: Content by Label Macro - option to display results which mention a specific page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With the new Confluence look, when you use the search URL link to access the search results by adding it on a page, clicking the link will show 'Page Not Found'. If you refresh that page, the search works.

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.0.0-57e69bf

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On the search field, search for all the pages with label "test"
# Search URL will be in this format: 
#* https://testinstance.atlassian.net/wiki/dosearchsite.action?cql=siteSearch+~+%22test%22+and+label+%3D+%22test%22&queryString=test
# Copy the search URL
# Create a new page and paste the search URL on the page
# Insert a text link using the same search URL 
# Save the page
# Access the link you added in Step 4
# Access the text link you inserted in Step 5


h3. Expected Results
* Accessing the search URL through the inserted links should show the search results.

h3. Actual Results
* Accessing the search URL through the inserted links will show 'Page Not Found'
 
h3. Notes
# The search URL works when it's added on the Overview page. 
# Accessing the search URL in the browser works.
fields.summary: Adding the search URL on a page is not working properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Removing the bullet list with backspace causing the cursor goes to the end of the previous line on the New Navigation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create the structure of bullet list as below:
1. orange
      a. one
      b. two
      c. three
      d. four
2. apple
      a.one
      b.two

More information on attached recordings on old and new navigation.

h3. Expected Results
* On new navigation should show the same result as the old navigation.

h3. Actual Results
* On new navigation showing a different result with the old navigation.

h3.Workaround
* No workaround.
fields.summary: Removing the bullet list with backspace causing the cursor goes to the end of the previous line on the New Navigation
